title: Empire State of Mind
description: The Blueprint 3 ’s third single is a love song to Jay-Z and Alicia Keys' home city of New York, which is also known as “the Empire State.” It was the first Jay-Z-lead single to ever top the  Billboard  “Hot 100,” sitting at #1 for five consecutive weeks (also being the last number #1 in the 2000s).

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Yeah, yeah, I'm out that Brooklyn, now I'm down in Tribeca
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Shawn Carter was born and raised in Brooklyn’s Marcy Houses. Back in 2012, DeNiro and Jay shared a few unpleasant words (mostly on DeNiro’s part) after he repeatedly failed to call the movie star back, and never delivered on a promise to record a song for the Tribeca Film Festival. DeNiro called him “rude [and] disrespectful,” with Hov replying that the veteran actor hadn’t shown him enough respect:It doesn’t matter who you are, everybody has to be respectful and everybody has to be a human bein

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Right next to De Niro, but I'll be hood forever
I'm the new Sinatra, and since I made it here
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: In the greatest Yankees rap reference of all-time, Jay-Z proclaims that he is a major reason for the high sales of New York Yankees headwear. Since the beginning of his career Hov has proudly worn a Yankees fitted to show support for his favorite MLB team; and his influence has rubbed off on the general public.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I can make it anywhere, yeah, they love me everywhere
I used to cop in Harlem, Hola my Dominicanos
Right there up on Broadway
Brought me back to that McDonald's
Took it to my stash spot, 560 State Street
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: A “stash spot” is a place to safely store cash and drugs. As you can see in the below photo, the Barclays Center, which Hov is an investor in, is now a stones throw away from Hov’s old bachelor pad.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Catch me in the Kitchen like a Simmons whipping pastry
Cruising down 8th Street, off-white Lexus
Driving so slow, but BK is from Texas
Me?, I'm out at Bed-Stuy, home of that boy Biggie
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Jay-Z and his close friend The Notorious B.I.G. were both born and raised in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Now I live on Billboard, and I brought my boys with me
Say "what up?" to Ty Ty, still sippin' Mai Tais
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Tyran “Ty Ty” Smith is Jay’s right-hand man, who has been working alongside him since the early Roc-A-Fella Records days. He is currently an A&R executive at Roc Nation, an entertainment company he co-founded with Hov in 2008.Since the ‘90s Hov and Ty Ty have been together, ordering themselves a Mai Tai, which is an alcoholic cocktail based on rum, Curaçao liqueur, orgeat syrup and lime juice.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Sitting courtside, Knicks and Nets give me high fives
Nigga, I be spiked out, I could trip a referee
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Referencing the horrific attacks on the World Trade Center on September 11th, 2001, where 2 planes were hijacked and flown right into the 2 buildings causing both of the towers to collapse killing around 3000 people.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Tell by my attitude that I am most definitely from
In New York, concrete jungle where dreams are made of (Ayy, uh, yeah, yeah)
There's nothing you can't do (Yeah, okay)
Now you're in New York (Aha, aha, aha)
These streets will make you feel brand new (New)
Big lights will inspire you (Come on)
Let's hear it for New York (You welcome, OG)
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Yankee Stadium is in Morrissania, a section of the Bronx which is oft nicknamed “The X.” Jay is at the game with his close friend and 40/40 Club co-owner Juan “OG” Perez, who Hov also shouts out in “My 1st Song” and “Success. ”Juan’s wife, Desiree Perez, is a close friend and adviser to Yankee’s controversial player Alex Rodriguez, so it’s no coincidence that Hov is there with him.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: New York, New York (I made you hot, nigga)
Catch me at the X with OG at a Yankees game
Shit, I made the Yankee hat more famous than a Yankee can
You should know I bleed blue, but I ain't a Crip though
But I got a gang of niggas walking with my clique, though
Welcome to the melting pot, corners where we selling rock
Afrika Bambaataa shit, home of the hip hop
Yellow Cab, Gypsy Cab, Dollar Cab, holla back
For foreigners that ain't fair, they act like they forgot how to add
Eight million stories out there in the naked
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: At the time of recording Jay-Z was a co-owner of the NBA’s Brooklyn Nets, and Brooklyn’s own Spike Lee is known as the quintessential court-side sitter at New York Knicks games. Like Spike, Hov sits so close to the court that he could stick his foot out a little too far and trip a referee.
